createIndex(address,address,bytes2).details: Deploys a new Index contract and stores the address. If the Index alreadyexists, returns its address, and does not emit a CreateIndex event

params.senderToken: address Sender token for the Index
params.signerToken: address Signer token for the Index

getLocators(address,address,bytes2,addre.details: Users are allowed to unstake from blacklisted indexes

params.limit: uint256 Total number of locators to return
params.protocol: bytes2 Protocol type for locators in Intent
params.senderToken: address Sender token of the trading pair
params.signerToken: address Signer token of the trading pair

getLocators(address,address,bytes2,addre.return: bytes32[] List of locatorsuint256[] List of scores corresponding to locatorsaddress The next cursor to provide for pagination

params.protocol: bytes2 Protocol type for locators in Intent
params.senderToken: address Sender token the user staked on
params.signerToken: address Signer token the user staked on

isOwner().details: Returns true if the caller is the current owner.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

params.token: address Token to remove from the blacklist

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.     * NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

setLocatorWhitelist(bytes2,address).details: Allows removal of locatorWhitelist by passing 0x0

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

unsetIntent(address,address,bytes2).details: Users are allowed to unstake from blacklisted indexes

params.signerToken: address Signer token of the Index being unstaked
